title: Who will be the last character shown sitting on the Iron Throne in the series Game of Thrones?
preds: Most claimants are dead. Danerys will not be trusted because of her bloodlust, Jon will finally accept he is meant to rule and had a lot of support to make that happen.

One gathers that many people who actually watch this program and care about it are very dissatisfied with Our Story So Far.  This has the effect of making me even more satisfied with my numbers, which are based on nothing but what I pick up from the larger universe, leavened with a highly arbitrary fudge factor.  Good luck, though.
I based it by looking at the crowd forcast.
I don't know anything about GoT and was going off popular opinions. I know a lot of people die in GoT and I've heard most about Daenerys and Jon Snow.
Most shows like to end in a big surprise, it is likely that someone unexpected will all of a sudden come up on top, and he/she would supposedly be a character that everyone supported
Most of the people said it so I will believe it as I have no clue of what's going in Game Of Thrones
The plot was killed so the ending would prob not make sense
It will be destroyed and no one wins.

Jaime's out because he done been crushed. Cersei, too, but 5% chance the throne itself is unsittable for various reasons and she was the last one in it.
With Daenerys going full psychopath, it would be very cynical but possible to put her in the winner spot as the series concludes, but there's also a chance she sits in it then destroys it, sits in it and is then assassinated and the successor destroys it, etc., making her technically the last to occupy it.
Jon Snow is the probability favorite, because the whole arc of the series is he stumbles into victories by being a good guy who doesn't want it and therefore is the only one who deserves it. The writers could still satisfy their need for twists by having him try to sacrifice himself for Dany and screwing it up and ending up good natured unwilling king.
Lot of dark horses out there, still, though, with Sansa being probably the most likely "other" pick. Plus let's not rule out Drogon saying "Screw y'all, I did all the work. I'm sitting in this thing."

Hmmm... What if NOBODY is seen sitting on the Iron Throne in the season finale?!!! Especially with all destruction around and the throne itself covered by debris... Or even melted under dragon's fire (small, but some possibility). It would make Cersei the last one sitting on the throne, right?
Jon is being touted as the king and Dany is mad for the throne. May be none because they could all die or one of them sits on the throne dying or something
Daenarys is most probably doomed to the same fate as her father, and eill be assassinated by Jon or Arya.

Well episode 5 was interesting wasn't it? Jamie and Ceresi are dead, so they are out. Tyrion is still alive, but I don't see him as the person who will be on the Iron Throne at the end. I mean he will have to contend with Dany in the last episode. I presume she will know that he freed Jamie, and he will make it known that what she did to King's Landing was wrong. I do have to give him a 1% chance though, because well, it's the last episode and the chance is greater than 0 because he's still alive.  At the very end of episode 5, when they show the preview of the next episode, there was a scene of Dany overlooking the Unsullied. Yes, this could be sort of a tease to an unexpected outcome, but lets realize she has a dragon and the Unsullied are on her side. The Stark family, including Jon may not be. Tyrion presumably is not. So for Dany to not be on the throne, someone else will have to overthrow her, but who will that someone be?  The presumptive answer is Jon, but how that happens, I'm simply not sure. Perhaps there is a popular uprising from the northmen, and the Stark family and they essentially will him to take the role, but the question of how Dany is defeated then remains. I don't see her giving up the Iron Throne willingly. Is the North going to defeat a dragon?  If it's not Jon then who? The only logical choice is Sansa, but how does this happen? It's the series finale so anything can happen. Maybe she leads a rebellion from the North, but with only 80 minutes to go?  There is always a wild card scenario in play but I think the odds have to be pretty evenly split between Jon, Dany and "none of the above"

Cersei is currently the last person but I'm pretty sure Daenerys will sit in the throne (I'm assuming the prophecy of the throne in a ruined hall where it's snowing is true and it was actually ash and thus the throne itself survived but 5% chance it was destroyed and Cersei is last).  I think Jon wins the game of thrones over Daenerys but rejects the throne which I suppose leaves Tyrion since pretty much everyone else is dead. Maybe it'll be Robyn Arryn or Gendry.
The trivial is Jon. i think (and hope) that there will be a twist and Sansa will sit on the Iron throne. was implied several times and along the series most rulers were women
I've read an epic novel series before. Too easy, baby!
Probably gonna be John Snow, the others are all too unsatisfactory but there always remains the chance of a wild card ending. It's GoT after all.
"Sansa Stark you may survive us yet"
Jon will rule the seven? kingdoms? Or will there be a queen of the north? Will Dany go mad queen? Will Stannis come back and wreck them all?

Characters whose storyline suggest a death ending are Cersei, Jaime, and Daenerys. I assign 5% to each.
-Cersei because she seems to have the most enemies and multiple assassins on the way.
-Jaime because his storyline to me suggests a redemption arc and because of the foreshadowing of "dying in the arms of the one he loves."
-Daenerys because she' turning into a Tyrant (all tyrants in the show seem to be getting killed off). This can change if her character takes a sudden turn next episode Tyrion to me seems unlikely because the show has not really talked of him being a ruler, but rather a follower. I Would still think him likelier than the characters above as the writers might want to "surprise" the audience. 10% Jon Snow makes sense as the next ruler for various reasons: virtuous, loved by people and can unite the north with the south, a good fighter, bloodline. But him winning is not consistent with the show's desire to surprise, and he seems as too good to be true of an option. I think none of the above characters being on the throne is consistent with the surprise element and I am not sure how to tip it towards either of these two options.

Cersei Lannister has the Iron Throne right now, so I place a 20% probability that she could be the last person shown actually sitting on the throne.  Jon Snow has the highest probability of winning, but I think he would despise the Iron Throne and would choose not to sit on it if king or will choose not to be king.  Daenerys just seems like she has a lower probability of winning now vs. Jon Snow

I don't think Daenerys can break the wheel, she seems to be morphing into a tyrant herself. Jon Snow would be the next logical heir as a Targaryen. However, if neither survive then I think the strongest claim goes to Tyrian as the last surviving Lannister (I think Jaime dies).
Tryion for irony, jointly held by Jon and Daenerys of the appeal to the "happy ending".
